actions.recommendation: Physical activity will help with anxiety, losing weight, manage your overall risk to chronic disease.
High Cholesterol, 9.8% risk of cardiovascular event in the next 10 years
High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) is a marker of inflammation that predicts incident heart attacks, stroke and arterial disease. A level lower than 1 is ideal
Raised cholesterol, waist circumference, smoker, exercise, diet
Raised cholesterol: Avoid fried food and try to get your fat from good fats like avo, nuts and olives. Supplement with Omega 3 2-4 g daily
Remember annual mammogram, bone density screen and pap smear.
Raised GGT- Liver marker. Please avoid all alcohol (even if only occasional) and repeat the markers in 6/52 and do a sonar if still raised.
